thread.title: Quayle makes mark as first female recruiter
thread.title_full: Quayle makes mark as first female recruiter

title: Quayle makes mark as first female recruiter
text:
Source: FOX SPORTS EMMA Quayle has broken a huge barrier to become the first female club recruiter in the AFL. 
A long-time Fairfax journalist, Quayle developed a reputation as a draft expert, penning two books on the varied journeys of draftees. 
That expertise has now been sought by the Giants, who have snapped up Quayle after interest was shown from a number of clubs. 
GWS footy boss Wayne Campbell indicated Quayle would be an invaluable addition to the club, given her entrenched role in scouting young talent. 
“We feel like we’re a club that likes to do things differently,” Campbell told The Age. 
“We’re really proud but we now need to make a success of it and we are partly proud because Emma in a way half chose us. 
“It’s no secret that several clubs had spoken to her about crossing over from journalism but she believes in us and our future and even though she gets on well with (GWS recruiters) Craig Cameron and Adrian Caruso she is plunging into the unknown in a way. 
“We need to make this work. It’s a legitimate role and we didn’t want it to be part of a game directive we wanted to own it — it’s coming out of our football budget.” 
Quayle’s appointment coincides with a great year for women in footy, with eight AFL clubs fielding women’s teams for the inaugural 2017 AFLW competition.
